Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2017 07:00PM spicedlife wrote: Hi! Stage 2 in 2012 and Stage 4 - bone mets in November 2017
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? zarovka SimonH

Posts.Content: May 22, 2012 02:39PM spicedlife wrote: Hi friends, my name is Jenny and I will receive my first chemo on June 4th.  I will have it 4 times, once every 3 wks i think.  thats about all i know.  I got my chemo port put in yesterday and that surgery was a piece of cake compared to the bmx w/ diep.  I am a little anxious about the chemo.  That is a miracle!  Because I do anxious full steam ahead over everything and literally make myself sick to my stomach.  I am trying to practice what I believe...God is good, He is in control, I can do this because He will do it through me.  Thanks so much for letting me share with all of you.  Jenny
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 30, 2012 01:07AM spicedlife wrote: Stayshiney and onvacation, thanks for answering my questions.  I am going to find a wig this week and maybe have my head shaved and fitted so that I control that part.  Also, i signed up for the look good feel better the Monday following my first chemo.  It is also the Monday I go back to work!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2012 07:09PM spicedlife wrote: I had my first treatment today.  It was a breeze.  I got home and ate chicken noodle soup w/ crackers and apple sauce.  I feel a little out of bodyish but other than that nothing.  I found out what the treatment is....taxotere/cytoxan x4.  My MO said that coming back for a shot of anything would be unusual  because insurance companies don't want to pay for them.  The chemo lady said that they stopped doing cold caps a couple of years ago because of micrometastics (so) to the scalp.  So I am not sure about soaking my finger and toenails in ice water.  She also said they used to do that regularly w/ patients receiving this treatment but no one does it now?  I don't know.  Thanks for letting me share! Jenny
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2012 07:39PM spicedlife wrote: melrose- good for you for being half way through.  I will ice and do the clear nail polish on my next treatment.  did you feel this good after your first treatment.  also,  can you believe we have already come thru surgeries and now are into chemo.  time really does fly!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2012 07:03PM spicedlife wrote: Ladies, it h as been 24 hrs since my first chemo and I have taken 2 phenergans.  Both were yesterday.  I am so tired I don't know how i will go back to work this coming Monday.  Help!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 29, 2012 10:03PM spicedlife wrote: Do you have to sit in the chair the whole time you are doing chemo?  Can you eat? Walk around? Take a nap? What is it like? Thanks, Jenny
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2012 09:40PM spicedlife wrote: StayShiney-  phenergan is an anti nausea and they gave me anti nausea and steroids with my first infusion.  I woke up once in the middle of the night to go to the restroom (usually 2 or 3 times!) so maybe it is all the anti nausea drugs.  So do I wait to take them when I am feeling sick or wait till I am sick to take one?  I thought I was really strong but now am wondering if I can do this. I will do this.  You guys are and I will too!  Thank you so much for listening to me whine and I will post tomorrow hopefully being better. Melrose--what is decadron?
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 23, 2012 11:25AM spicedlife wrote: Hi Y'all (lol) - this is Jenny from Tx   Thanks for all of your positive words of support.  The place where they put my chemo port hurts quite a bit so I took an 800 milligram motrin and am drinking a 7 up and waiting for it to kick in.   I am so glad that we have a place to come and be honest and real and practice looking for the good things in life!  I just called my HR Dept and told them the come back to work plan and they are behind me 100% .  Now that is good news.  My plans for the weekend are to find a wig and sign up for a look better feel better class and take walks and plan some fun movies to watch.  Also to talk to you all and stay off the "what if" sites. Jenny
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 28, 2012 05:41PM spicedlife wrote: Hi Ladies,  I was just wondering how many of you work outside the home and were able to keep working during chemo.  I am employed at a Credit Union and it is very difficult to feel very bad and still work with the members.  I don't want to be a big baby and I have been off of work since April 16th and they need me and of course I need my job.  Any comments or tips on how you guys made it through would be great. Thanks, Jenny
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2012 04:58PM spicedlife wrote: Melrose--how ru doing today?  How is everyone?  I had my first tx Monday, went to counselor Tuesday at 4pm and will try to go to church tonite.  Otherwise I have been in bed.  Short walk Monday night.  I have called my MO because I can't go back to work feeling like this.  I am splitting my anti nausea med in half and maybe i wont be so sleepy.  Janie-  thanks for the encouraging words.  Thanks to you all! Stacie- im downing water at least 3 quarts a day.  I will up it if it helps!
